You are about to create a new review round for this submission. Files that have not been used in other review rounds are listed below. By default, the reviewers from the previous review round have been selected to participate in this new review round.
Revised files uploaded by author (or editor) are listed here, with the editor checking (✔) them, prior to selecting an action for them.

Any files that have already been uploaded to any submission stage (even Editorial or Production) can be chosen for review by checking the Include checkbox below and clicking Search: all available files will be listed and can be chosen for inclusion. Additional files not already uploaded to a stage can be added to this listing by clicking the Upload Review File link.
This stage begins with editor using Select Files to identify the submission files for review.

The editor uses Add Reviewer to invite readers to review the submission files. The editor checks (✔) the reviews after consulting them. Reminders can be sent to reviewers by clicking on the red envelope if the review is currently overdue.
Include all files from all accessible workflow stages.

Additional files not already uploaded to a stage can be added to the listing by clicking the Upload A Final Draft link.

To add a participant to this stage of the submission, select a user group from the drop-down menu, then add a user.

In this stage, after initially considering whether the submission appears suitable for the press, the editor selects the appropriate action, which includes notifying the author: Internal Review (editor selects files for review within the press); External Review (editor selects files sent out for review); Accept Submission (editor selects files for Editorial stage); or Decline Submission (editor archives submission).
In this stage, the submission is copyedited, leading to the production of a fair copy. The editor, after approving the fair copy, sends the files to Production.

The assigned copyeditor downloads the files selected for this grid and copyedits them. For edited volumes, this may mean breaking the submission up into discrete chapters for chapter-authors to go over the copyedits, which are uploaded in Copyediting Files.

The copyeditor uploads the copyedited files, assigning authors (and others as needed) to review copyedits and answer queries. The check boxes under Considered turn green when the copyedit files are first viewed by the author (and others), while their names becomes links when the review is complete. The copyeditor indicates (✔) the copyedit reviews have been considered before preparing and uploading a clean copy, which the editor is then asked to approve before sending to Production.
The copyeditor uploads a clean or fair copy of the submission for review by the editor, prior to sending it to Production.
Approving this copyedited file will make it available to send to production stage. Do you want to approve this file?
Disapproving this copyedited file will make it unavailable to send to production stage. Do you want to disapprove this file?

All approved and copyedited submission files from the Editorial stage are available in the Production Ready section. Different formats (digital, hardback, paperback/softback) can be configured for this submission in the Publication Formats section. The submission is considered complete when the Catalog Entry metadata has been approved, and all Publication Formats checklist items are marked complete.
The layout editor prepares these files for each of the selected Publication Formats, before uploading them in Proofreading for each format.

Different publication formats, such as hardcover, softcover and digital, can be uploaded in the Publication Formats section below. You can use the publication formats grid below as a checklist for what still needs to be done to publish a publication format.

Add one or more publication formats (eg. hardback; softback/paperback; digital; audio) here. Upload final galley proofs for each publication format below, and audit and approve them. For the galley to be listed in the public catalog, approve the Catalog Entry metadata and ensure that each format checklist item has been completed.

In this stage, reviewers associated with the press go over the submission. The editor assigns reviewers and assesses the reviews, before selecting the appropriate action, which includes notifying the author: Request Revisions (editor evaluates revisions and selects the appropriate action); Resubmit for Review (editor initiates another round of reviews before selecting the appropriate action); External Review (editor selects files to send to External Review); Accept for Submission (editor selects files for Editorial stage); or Decline Submission (editor archives submission).

In this stage, reviewers external to the press go over the submission. The editor assigns reviewers and assesses the reviews, before selecting the appropriate action, which includes notifying the author: Request Revisions (editor evaluates revisions and selects the appropriate action); Resubmit for Review (editor initiates another round of reviews before selecting the appropriate action); Accept Submission (editor selects files for Editorial stage); or Decline Submission (editor archives submission).
